The_DT Magical_NNP Control_NNP of_IN Rain_NNP

OF_IN THE_DT THINGS_NNS which_WDT the_DT public_JJ magician_NN sets_VBZ himself_PRP to_TO do_VB for_IN the_DT
good_JJ of_IN the_DT tribe_NN one_CD of_IN the_DT chief_NN is_VBZ to_TO control_VB the_DT weather_NN and_CC
especially_RB to_TO ensure_VB an_DT adequate_JJ fall_NN of_IN rain_NN Water_NN is_VBZ an_DT essential_JJ
of_IN life_NN and_CC in_IN most_RBS countries_NNS the_DT supply_NN of_IN it_PRP depends_VBZ upon_IN
showers_NNS Without_IN rain_NN vegetation_NN withers_IN animals_NNS and_CC men_NNS languish_NN
and_CC die_VBP Hence_RB in_IN savage_JJ communities_NNS the_DT rain-maker_NN is_VBZ a_DT very_RB

Thus_RB for_IN example_NN in_IN a_DT village_NN near_IN Dorpat_NNP in_IN Russia_NNP when_WRB rain_NN

particular_JJ kind_NN of_IN tree_NN in_IN water_NN and_CC then_RB scattering_VBG the_DT moisture_NN

XV_NNP The_DT Worship_NN of_IN the_DT Oak_NNP

XVI_NNP Dianus_NNP and_CC Diana_NNP

XXI_NNP Tabooed_NNP Things_NNS



The_DT Meaning_NN of_IN Taboo_NN

THUS_PRP in_IN primitive_JJ society_NN the_DT rules_NNS of_IN ceremonial_NN purity_NN observed_VBN by_IN
divine_JJ kings_NNS chiefs_NNS and_CC priests_NNS agree_VBP in_IN many_JJ respects_NNS with_IN the_DT
rules_NNS observed_VBN by_IN homicides_NNS mourners_NNS women_NNS in_IN childbed_JJ girls_NNS at_IN
puberty_NN hunters_NNS and_CC fishermen_NNS and_CC so_RB on_IN To_TO us_PRP these_DT various_JJ
classes_NNS of_IN persons_NNS appear_VBP to_TO differ_VB totally_RB in_IN character_NN and_CC
condition_NN some_DT of_IN them_PRP we_PRP should_MD call_VB holy_JJ others_NNS we_PRP might_MD
pronounce_NN unclean_JJ and_CC polluted_VBN But_CC the_DT savage_JJ makes_VBZ no_DT such_JJ moral_JJ
distinction_NN between_IN them_PRP the_DT conceptions_NNS of_IN holiness_NN and_CC pollution_NN
are_VBP not_RB yet_RB differentiated_JJ in_IN his_PRP$ mind_NN To_TO him_PRP the_DT common_JJ feature_NN of_IN
all_PDT these_DT persons_NNS is_VBZ that_IN they_PRP are_VBP dangerous_JJ and_CC in_IN danger_NN and_CC the_DT
danger_NN in_IN which_WDT they_PRP stand_VBP and_CC to_TO which_WDT they_PRP expose_VBP others_NNS is_VBZ what_WP
we_PRP should_MD call_VB spiritual_JJ or_CC ghostly_RB and_CC therefore_RB imaginary_JJ The_DT
danger_NN however_RB is_VBZ not_RB less_RBR real_JJ because_IN it_PRP is_VBZ imaginary_NN
imagination_NN acts_VBZ upon_IN man_NN as_RB really_RB as_IN does_VBZ gravitation_NN and_CC may_MD

XXVIII_NNP The_DT Killing_NNP of_IN the_DT Tree-Spirit_NN



The_DT Whitsuntide_NNP Mummers_NNP

XXIX_NNP The_DT Myth_NNP of_IN Adonis_NNP

THE_DT SPECTACLE_NNP of_IN the_DT great_JJ changes_NNS which_WDT annually_RB pass_VBP over_IN the_DT face_NN

XXXVIII_NNP The_DT Myth_NNP of_IN Osiris_NNP

IN_IN ANCIENT_NNP EGYPT_NNP the_DT god_NN whose_WP$ death_NN and_CC resurrection_NN were_VBD annually_RB
celebrated_VBN with_IN alternate_JJ sorrow_NN and_CC joy_NN was_VBD Osiris_NNP the_DT most_RBS
popular_JJ of_IN all_DT Egyptian_JJ deities_NNS and_CC there_EX are_VBP good_JJ grounds_NNS for_IN
classing_VBG him_PRP in_IN one_CD of_IN his_PRP$ aspects_NNS with_IN Adonis_NNP and_CC Attis_NNP as_IN a_DT
personification_NN of_IN the_DT great_JJ yearly_JJ vicissitudes_NNS of_IN nature_NN
especially_RB of_IN the_DT corn_NN But_CC the_DT immense_JJ vogue_NN which_WDT he_PRP enjoyed_VBD for_IN
many_JJ ages_NNS induced_VBD his_PRP$ devoted_JJ worshippers_NNS to_TO heap_NN upon_IN him_PRP the_DT
attributes_NNS and_CC powers_NNS of_IN many_JJ other_JJ gods_NNS so_IN that_IN it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB always_RB
easy_JJ to_TO strip_VB him_PRP so_RB to_TO say_VB of_IN his_PRP$ borrowed_VBN plumes_NNS and_CC to_TO restore_VB
them_PRP to_TO their_PRP$ proper_JJ owners_NNS

The_DT story_NN of_IN Osiris_NNP is_VBZ told_VBN in_IN a_DT connected_VBN form_NN only_RB by_IN Plutarch_NN
whose_WP$ narrative_NN has_VBZ been_VBN confirmed_VBN and_CC to_TO some_DT extent_NN amplified_VBN in_IN
modern_JJ times_NNS by_IN the_DT evidence_NN of_IN the_DT monuments_NNS

Osiris_NNP was_VBD the_DT offspring_NN of_IN an_DT intrigue_NN between_IN the_DT earth-god_NN Seb_NN
Keb_NNP or_CC Geb_NNP as_IN the_DT name_NN is_VBZ sometimes_RB transliterated_VBN and_CC the_DT
sky-goddess_NN Nut_NNP The_DT Greeks_NNP identified_VBD his_PRP$ parents_NNS with_IN their_PRP$ own_JJ
deities_NNS Cronus_NNP and_CC Rhea_NNP When_WRB the_DT sun-god_NN Ra_NNP perceived_VBD that_IN his_PRP$ wife_NN
Nut_NNP had_VBD been_VBN unfaithful_JJ to_TO him_PRP he_PRP declared_VBD with_IN a_DT curse_NN that_IN she_PRP
should_MD be_VB delivered_VBN of_IN the_DT child_NN in_IN no_DT month_NN and_CC no_DT year_NN But_CC the_DT
goddess_NN had_VBD another_DT lover_NN the_DT god_NN Thoth_NNP or_CC Hermes_NNP as_IN the_DT Greeks_NNS
called_VBN him_PRP and_CC he_PRP playing_VBG at_IN draughts_NNS with_IN the_DT moon_NN won_VBN from_IN her_PRP a_DT
seventy-second_JJ part_NN of_IN every_DT day_NN and_CC having_VBG compounded_VBN five_CD whole_NN
days_NNS out_IN of_IN these_DT parts_NNS he_PRP added_VBD them_PRP to_TO the_DT Egyptian_JJ year_NN of_IN three_CD
hundred_CD and_CC sixty_CD days_NNS This_DT was_VBD the_DT mythical_JJ origin_NN of_IN the_DT five_CD
supplementary_NN days_NNS which_WDT the_DT Egyptians_NNS annually_RB inserted_VBN at_IN the_DT end_NN
of_IN every_DT year_NN in_IN order_NN to_TO establish_VB a_DT harmony_NN between_IN lunar_NN and_CC
solar_JJ time_NN On_IN these_DT five_CD days_NNS regarded_VBN as_IN outside_IN the_DT year_NN of_IN
twelve_CD months_NNS the_DT curse_NN of_IN the_DT sun-god_NN did_VBD not_RB rest_NN and_CC
accordingly_RB Osiris_NNP was_VBD born_VBN on_IN the_DT first_JJ of_IN them_PRP At_IN his_PRP$ nativity_NN a_DT
voice_NN rang_VBD out_RP proclaiming_VBG that_IN the_DT Lord_NN of_IN All_DT had_VBD come_VBN into_IN the_DT
world_NN Some_DT say_VBP that_IN a_DT certain_JJ Pamyles_NNP heard_VBD a_DT voice_NN from_IN the_DT temple_NN
at_IN Thebes_DT bidding_VBG him_PRP announce_VB with_IN a_DT shout_NN that_IN a_DT great_JJ king_NN the_DT
beneficent_JJ Osiris_NNP was_VBD born_VBN But_CC Osiris_NNP was_VBD not_RB the_DT only_JJ child_NN of_IN
his_PRP$ mother_NN On_IN the_DT second_NN of_IN the_DT supplementary_JJ days_NNS she_PRP gave_VBD birth_NN
to_TO the_DT elder_JJR Horus_NNP on_IN the_DT third_JJ to_TO the_DT god_NN Set_NNP whom_WP the_DT Greeks_NNS
called_VBN Typhon_NNP on_IN the_DT fourth_JJ to_TO the_DT goddess_JJ Isis_NNP and_CC on_IN the_DT fifth_JJ
to_TO the_DT goddess_JJ Nephthys_NNP Afterwards_RB Set_VB married_VBN his_PRP$ sister_NN Nephthys_.
and_CC Osiris_NNP married_VBD his_PRP$ sister_NN Isis_.

Reigning_VBG as_IN a_DT king_NN on_IN earth_NN Osiris_NNP reclaimed_VBD the_DT Egyptians_NNS from_IN
savagery_NN gave_VBD them_PRP laws_NNS and_CC taught_VBD them_PRP to_TO worship_VB the_DT gods_NNS
Before_IN his_PRP$ time_NN the_DT Egyptians_NNS had_VBD been_VBN cannibals_NNS But_CC Isis_IN the_DT
sister_NN and_CC wife_NN of_IN Osiris_NNP discovered_VBD wheat_NN and_CC barley_NN growing_VBG wild_JJ
and_CC Osiris_NNP introduced_VBD the_DT cultivation_NN of_IN these_DT grains_NNS amongst_IN his_PRP$
people_NNS who_WP forthwith_IN abandoned_VBN cannibalism_NN and_CC took_VBD kindly_RB to_TO a_DT
corn_NN diet_NN Moreover_RB Osiris_NNP is_VBZ said_VBN to_TO have_VB been_VBN the_DT first_JJ to_TO gather_VB
fruit_NN from_IN trees_NNS to_TO train_VB the_DT vine_NN to_TO poles_NNS and_CC to_TO tread_VB the_DT
grapes_NNS Eager_NNP to_TO communicate_VB these_DT beneficent_JJ discoveries_NNS to_TO all_PDT
mankind_NN he_PRP committed_VBD the_DT whole_JJ government_NN of_IN Egypt_NNP to_TO his_PRP$ wife_NN
Isis_NNP and_CC travelled_VBN over_IN the_DT world_NN diffusing_VBG the_DT blessings_NNS of_IN

harsh_JJ climate_NN or_CC niggardly_NN soil_NN forbade_IN the_DT cultivation_NN of_IN the_DT vine_NN
he_PRP taught_VBD the_DT inhabitants_NNS to_TO console_VB themselves_PRP for_IN the_DT want_NN of_IN wine_NN
by_IN brewing_VBG beer_NN from_IN barley_NN Loaded_VBN with_IN the_DT wealth_NN that_WDT had_VBD been_VBN
showered_VBN upon_IN him_PRP by_IN grateful_JJ nations_NNS he_PRP returned_VBD to_TO Egypt_NNP and_CC on_IN
account_NN of_IN the_DT benefits_NNS he_PRP had_VBD conferred_VBN on_IN mankind_NN he_PRP was_VBD
unanimously_RB hailed_VBD and_CC worshipped_VBD as_IN a_DT deity_NN But_CC his_PRP$ brother_NN Set_VB
whom_WP the_DT Greeks_NNP called_VBD Typhon_NNP with_IN seventy-two_CD others_NNS plotted_.
against_IN him_PRP Having_VBG taken_VBN the_DT measure_NN of_IN his_PRP$ good_JJ brother_NN s_VBZ body_NN by_IN
stealth_NN the_DT bad_JJ brother_NN Typhon_NNP fashioned_VBD and_CC highly_RB decorated_VBN a_DT
coffer_NN of_IN the_DT same_JJ size_NN and_CC once_RB when_WRB they_PRP were_VBD all_DT drinking_NN and_CC
making_VBG merry_NN he_PRP brought_VBD in_IN the_DT coffer_NN and_CC jestingly_RB promised_VBD to_TO give_VB
it_PRP to_TO the_DT one_CD whom_WP it_PRP should_MD fit_VB exactly_RB Well_RB they_PRP all_DT tried_VBD one_CD
after_IN the_DT other_JJ but_CC it_PRP fitted_VBD none_NN of_IN them_PRP Last_JJ of_IN all_DT Osiris_NNP
stepped_VBD into_IN it_PRP and_CC lay_VBD down_IN On_IN that_IN the_DT conspirators_NNS ran_VBD and_CC
slammed_VBD the_DT lid_NN down_IN on_IN him_PRP nailed_VBD it_PRP fast_RB soldered_VBD it_PRP with_IN molten_NN

seventeenth_JJ day_NN of_IN the_DT month_NN Athyr_IN when_WRB the_DT sun_NN is_VBZ in_IN the_DT sign_NN of_IN
the_DT Scorpion_NN and_CC in_IN the_DT eight-and_CD twentieth_JJ year_NN of_IN the_DT reign_NN or_CC
the_DT life_NN of_IN Osiris_NNP When_WRB Isis_NNP heard_VBD of_IN it_PRP she_PRP sheared_VBD off_RP a_DT lock_NN of_IN
her_PRP$ hair_NN put_VBD on_IN a_DT mourning_VBG attire_NN and_CC wandered_VBD disconsolately_RB up_IN
and_CC down_IN seeking_VBG the_DT body_NN

By_IN the_DT advice_NN of_IN the_DT god_NN of_IN wisdom_NN she_PRP took_VBD refuge_NN in_IN the_DT papyrus_NN
swamps_NNS of_IN the_DT Delta_NNP Seven_CD scorpions_NNS accompanied_VBD her_PRP in_IN her_PRP$ flight_NN
One_CD evening_NN when_WRB she_PRP was_VBD weary_JJ she_PRP came_VBD to_TO the_DT house_NN of_IN a_DT woman_NN
who_WP alarmed_JJ at_IN the_DT sight_NN of_IN the_DT scorpions_NNS shut_VBD the_DT door_NN in_IN her_PRP$
face_NN Then_RB one_CD of_IN the_DT scorpions_NNS crept_VBD under_IN the_DT door_NN and_CC stung_VBD the_DT
child_NN of_IN the_DT woman_NN that_IN he_PRP died_VBD But_CC when_WRB Isis_NNP heard_VBD the_DT mother_NN s_VBZ
lamentation_NN her_PRP$ heart_NN was_VBD touched_VBN and_CC she_PRP laid_VBD her_PRP$ hands_NNS on_IN the_DT
child_NN and_CC uttered_VBD her_PRP$ powerful_JJ spells_NNS so_RB the_DT poison_NN was_VBD driven_VBN out_IN
of_IN the_DT child_NN and_CC he_PRP lived_VBD Afterwards_RB Isis_NNP herself_PRP gave_VBD birth_NN to_TO a_DT
son_NN in_IN the_DT swamps_NNS She_PRP had_VBD conceived_VBN him_PRP while_IN she_PRP fluttered_VBD in_IN the_DT
form_NN of_IN a_DT hawk_NN over_IN the_DT corpse_NN of_IN her_PRP$ dead_JJ husband_NN The_DT infant_NN was_VBD
the_DT younger_JJR Horus_NNP who_WP in_IN his_PRP$ youth_NN bore_VBD the_DT name_NN of_IN Harpocrates_NNP
that_WDT is_VBZ the_DT child_NN Horus_NNP Him_NNP Buto_CC the_DT goddess_NN of_IN the_DT north_NN hid_VBN
from_IN the_DT wrath_NN of_IN his_PRP$ wicked_JJ uncle_NN Set_VB Yet_RB she_PRP could_MD not_RB guard_VB him_PRP
from_IN all_DT mishap_NN for_IN one_CD day_NN when_WRB Isis_NNP came_VBD to_TO her_PRP$ little_JJ son_NN s_VBZ
hiding-place_NN she_PRP found_VBD him_PRP stretched_VBN lifeless_RB and_CC rigid_JJ on_IN the_DT
ground_NN a_DT scorpion_NN had_VBD stung_VBN him_PRP Then_RB Isis_NNP prayed_VBD to_TO the_DT sun-god_NN Ra_.
for_IN help_NN The_DT god_NN hearkened_VBD to_TO her_PRP and_CC staid_VBD his_PRP$ bark_NN in_IN the_DT sky_NN
and_CC sent_VBD down_RP Thoth_NNP to_TO teach_VB her_PRP the_DT spell_NN by_IN which_WDT she_PRP might_MD
restore_VB her_PRP$ son_NN to_TO life_NN She_PRP uttered_VBD the_DT words_NNS of_IN power_NN and_CC
straightway_RB the_DT poison_NN flowed_VBD from_IN the_DT body_NN of_IN Horus_NNP air_NN passed_VBN
into_IN him_PRP and_CC he_PRP lived_VBD Then_RB Thoth_NNP ascended_VBD up_RP into_IN the_DT sky_NN and_CC took_VBD
his_PRP$ place_NN once_RB more_RBR in_IN the_DT bark_NN of_IN the_DT sun_NN and_CC the_DT bright_JJ pomp_NN

Dionysus_IN the_DT Goat_NNP and_CC the_DT Bull_NNP

in_IN animal_NN form_NN May_MD not_RB this_DT fact_NN explain_VB the_DT relation_NN in_IN which_WDT
certain_JJ animals_NNS stood_VBD to_TO the_DT ancient_JJ deities_NNS of_IN vegetation_NN
Dionysus_NNP Demeter_NNP Adonis_NNP Attis_NNP and_CC Osiris_NNP

To_TO begin_VB with_IN Dionysus_JJ We_PRP have_VBP seen_VBN that_IN he_PRP was_VBD represented_VBN
sometimes_RB as_IN a_DT goat_NN and_CC sometimes_RB as_IN a_DT bull_NN As_IN a_DT goat_NN he_PRP can_MD hardly_RB
be_VB separated_VBN from_IN the_DT minor_JJ divinities_NNS the_DT Pans_NNP Satyrs_NNP and_CC

goatskin_NN Further_RB the_DT Fauns_NNS the_DT Italian_JJ counterpart_NN of_IN the_DT Greek_NNP

further_RB brought_VBD out_RP by_IN their_PRP$ association_NN or_CC even_RB identification_NN
with_IN Silvanus_NNP and_CC the_DT Silvanuses_NNS who_WP as_IN their_PRP$ name_NN of_IN itself_PRP

navel_NN many_JJ people_NNS indeed_RB apply_VBP the_DT juice_NN to_TO all_DT the_DT joints_NNS of_IN their_PRP$
body_NN but_CC the_DT better-informed_JJ say_NN that_IN this_DT is_VBZ a_DT vulgar_JJ departure_NN
from_IN ancient_JJ custom_NN After_IN this_DT ceremony_NN in_IN the_DT great_JJ kraal_NN every_DT
man_NN goes_VBZ home_NN to_TO his_PRP$ own_JJ kraal_NN assembles_NNS all_PDT the_DT members_NNS of_IN his_PRP$
family_NN men_NNS women_NNS and_CC children_NNS and_CC smears_VBZ them_PRP all_DT with_IN the_DT juice_NN

The_DT Bororo_NNP Indians_NNPS of_IN Brazil_NNP think_VBP that_IN it_PRP would_MD be_VB certain_JJ death_NN to_TO

thereby_RB to_TO prevent_VB the_DT sacred_JJ food_NN from_IN being_VBG polluted_VBN by_IN contact_NN
with_IN common_JJ food_NN in_IN the_DT stomach_NN of_IN the_DT eater_NN For_IN the_DT same_JJ reason_NN
Catholics_NNPS partake_NN of_IN the_DT Eucharist_NNP fasting_NN and_CC among_IN the_DT pastoral_JJ
Masai_NNP of_IN Eastern_NNP Africa_NNP the_DT young_JJ warriors_NNS who_WP live_VBP on_IN meat_NN and_CC
milk_NN exclusively_RB are_VBP obliged_VBN to_TO eat_VB nothing_NN but_CC milk_NN for_IN so_RB many_JJ
days_NNS and_CC then_RB nothing_NN but_CC meat_NN for_IN so_RB many_JJ more_JJR and_CC before_IN they_PRP
pass_NN from_IN the_DT one_CD food_NN to_TO the_DT other_JJ they_PRP must_MD make_VB sure_JJ that_IN none_NN of_IN
the_DT old_JJ food_NN remains_VBZ in_IN their_PRP$ stomachs_NNS this_DT they_PRP do_VBP by_IN swallowing_VBG a_DT
very_RB powerful_JJ purgative_NN and_CC emetic_NN

In_IN some_DT of_IN the_DT festivals_NNS which_WDT we_PRP have_VBP examined_VBN the_DT sacrament_NN of_IN
first-fruits_NNS is_VBZ combined_VBN with_IN a_DT sacrifice_NN or_CC presentation_NN of_IN them_PRP to_TO
gods_NNS or_CC spirits_NNS and_CC in_IN course_NN of_IN time_NN the_DT sacrifice_NN of_IN first-fruits_PRP$
tends_VBZ to_TO throw_VB the_DT sacrament_NN into_IN the_DT shade_NN if_IN not_RB to_TO supersede_VB it_PRP
The_DT mere_JJ fact_NN of_IN offering_VBG the_DT first-fruits_NNS to_TO the_DT gods_NNS or_CC spirits_NNS
comes_VBZ now_RB to_TO be_VB thought_VBN a_DT sufficient_JJ preparation_NN for_IN eating_VBG the_DT new_JJ
corn_NN the_DT higher_JJR powers_NNS having_VBG received_VBN their_PRP$ share_NN man_NN is_VBZ free_JJ to_TO
enjoy_VB the_DT rest_NN This_DT mode_NN of_IN viewing_VBG the_DT new_JJ fruits_NNS implies_VBZ that_IN
they_PRP are_VBP regarded_VBN no_RB longer_RB as_IN themselves_PRP instinct_NN with_IN divine_JJ life_NN
but_CC merely_RB as_IN a_DT gift_NN bestowed_VBN by_IN the_DT gods_NNS upon_IN man_NN who_WP is_VBZ bound_VBN to_TO

Eating_VBG the_DT God_NNP among_IN the_DT Aztecs_NNS

THE_DT CUSTOM_NNP of_IN eating_VBG bread_NN sacramentally_RB as_IN the_DT body_NN of_IN a_DT god_NN was_VBD
practised_VBN by_IN the_DT Aztecs_NNP before_IN the_DT discovery_NN and_CC conquest_NN of_IN Mexico_NNP
by_IN the_DT Spaniards_NNS Twice_RB a_DT year_NN in_IN May_NNP and_CC December_NNP an_DT image_NN of_IN the_DT
great_JJ Mexican_JJ god_NN Huitzilopochtli_NNP or_CC Vitzilipuztli_NNP was_VBD made_VBN of_IN
dough_NN then_RB broken_VBN in_IN pieces_NNS and_CC solemnly_RB eaten_VBN by_IN his_PRP$ worshippers_NNS
The_DT May_NNP ceremony_NN is_VBZ thus_RB described_VBN by_IN the_DT historian_NN Acosta_NNP The_NNP
Mexicans_NNS in_IN the_DT month_NN of_IN May_NNP made_VBD their_PRP$ principal_JJ feast_NN to_TO their_PRP$ god_NN
Vitzilipuztli_NNP and_CC two_CD days_NNS before_IN this_DT feast_NN the_DT virgins_NNS whereof_IN I_PRP
have_VBP spoken_VBN the_DT which_WDT were_VBD shut_VBN up_RB and_CC secluded_VBN in_IN the_DT same_JJ temple_NN
and_CC were_VBD as_IN it_PRP were_VBD religious_JJ women_NNS did_VBD mingle_JJ a_DT quantity_NN of_IN the_DT
seed_NN of_IN beets_NNS with_IN roasted_JJ maize_NN and_CC then_RB they_PRP did_VBD mould_VB it_PRP with_IN
honey_NN making_VBG an_DT idol_NN of_IN that_DT paste_NN in_IN bigness_NN like_IN to_TO that_DT of_IN wood_NN
putting_VBG instead_RB of_IN eyes_NNS grains_NNS of_IN green_JJ glass_NN of_IN blue_JJ or_CC white_JJ and_CC
for_IN teeth_NNS grains_NNS of_IN maize_NN set_VBD forth_RB with_IN all_PDT the_DT ornament_NN and_CC
furniture_NN that_IN I_PRP have_VBP said_VBD This_DT being_NN finished_VBD all_RB the_DT noblemen_NNS
came_VBD and_CC brought_VBD it_PRP an_DT exquisite_JJ and_CC rich_JJ garment_NN like_IN unto_IN that_DT of_IN

Vitzilipuztli_NNP they_PRP came_VBD crowned_VBN with_IN garlands_NNS of_IN maize_NN roasted_VBN and_CC

From_IN this_DT interesting_JJ passage_NN we_PRP learn_VBP that_IN the_DT ancient_JJ Mexicans_NNS

their_PRP$ god_NN so_IN that_IN all_DT who_WP thereupon_DT partook_NN of_IN the_DT consecrated_VBN

was_VBD also_RB familiar_JJ to_TO the_DT Aryans_NNP of_IN ancient_JJ India_NNP long_JJ before_IN the_DT
spread_NN and_CC even_RB the_DT rise_NN of_IN Christianity_NNP The_DT Brahmans_NNPS taught_VBD that_IN

of_IN men_NNS by_IN the_DT manipulation_NN of_IN the_DT priest_NN We_PRP read_VBD that_IN when_WRB it_PRP the_DT
rice-cake_NN still_RB consists_VBZ of_IN rice-meal_NN it_PRP is_VBZ the_DT hair_NN When_WRB he_PRP
pours_NNS water_NN on_IN it_PRP it_PRP becomes_VBZ skin_NN When_WRB he_PRP mixes_VBZ it_PRP it_PRP becomes_VBZ
flesh_NN for_IN then_RB it_PRP becomes_VBZ consistent_JJ and_CC consistent_JJ also_RB is_VBZ the_DT
flesh_NN When_WRB it_PRP is_VBZ baked_VBN it_PRP becomes_VBZ bone_NN for_IN then_RB it_PRP becomes_VBZ
somewhat_RB hard_JJ and_CC hard_JJ is_VBZ the_DT bone_NN And_CC when_WRB he_PRP is_VBZ about_IN to_TO take_VB it_PRP
off_IN the_DT fire_NN and_CC sprinkles_VBZ it_PRP with_IN butter_NN he_PRP changes_VBZ it_PRP into_IN

sacrifice_NN

Now_RB too_RB we_PRP can_MD perfectly_RB understand_VB why_WRB on_IN the_DT day_NN of_IN their_PRP$ solemn_JJ
communion_NN with_IN the_DT deity_NN the_DT Mexicans_NNPS refused_VBD to_TO eat_VB any_DT other_JJ food_NN

God_NNP in_IN their_PRP$ stomachs_NNS by_IN contact_NN with_IN common_JJ things_NNS A_DT similar_JJ pious_JJ
fear_NN led_VBD the_DT Creek_NNP and_CC Seminole_NNP Indians_NNPS as_IN we_PRP saw_VBD to_TO adopt_VB the_DT
more_RBR thoroughgoing_JJ expedient_NN of_IN rinsing_VBG out_IN their_PRP$ bodies_NNS by_IN a_DT strong_JJ

At_IN the_DT festival_NN of_IN the_DT winter_NN solstice_NN in_IN December_NNP the_DT Aztecs_NNP killed_VBN
their_PRP$ god_NN Huitzilopochtli_NNP in_IN effigy_NN first_RB and_CC ate_VBD him_PRP afterwards_RB As_IN

At_IN another_DT festival_NN the_DT Mexicans_NNPS made_VBD little_JJ images_NNS like_IN men_NNS which_WDT

Many_JJ Manii_NNS at_IN Aricia_NNP

WE_NNP are_VBP now_RB able_JJ to_TO suggest_VB an_DT explanation_NN of_IN the_DT proverb_NN There_EX are_VBP
many_JJ Manii_NNP at_IN Aricia_NNP Certain_NNP loaves_NNS made_VBD in_IN the_DT shape_NN of_IN men_NNS were_VBD
called_VBN by_IN the_DT Romans_NNPS maniae_NN and_CC it_PRP appears_VBZ that_IN this_DT kind_NN of_IN loaf_NN
was_VBD especially_RB made_VBN at_IN Aricia_NNP Now_RB Mania_NNP the_DT name_NN of_IN one_CD of_IN these_DT
loaves_NNS was_VBD also_RB the_DT name_NN of_IN the_DT Mother_NNP or_CC Grandmother_NNP of_IN Ghosts_NNS to_TO
whom_WP woollen_JJ effigies_NNS of_IN men_NNS and_CC women_NNS were_VBD dedicated_VBN at_IN the_DT
festival_NN of_IN the_DT Compitalia_NNP These_DT effigies_NNS were_VBD hung_VBN at_IN the_DT doors_NNS of_IN
all_PDT the_DT houses_NNS in_IN Rome_NNP one_CD effigy_NN was_VBD hung_VBN up_RP for_IN every_DT free_JJ person_NN
in_IN the_DT house_NN and_CC one_CD effigy_NN of_IN a_DT different_JJ kind_NN for_IN every_DT slave_NN
The_DT reason_NN was_VBD that_IN on_IN this_DT day_NN the_DT ghosts_NNS of_IN the_DT dead_JJ were_VBD believed_VBN
to_TO be_VB going_VBG about_RB and_CC it_PRP was_VBD hoped_VBN that_IN either_DT out_IN of_IN good_JJ nature_NN
or_CC through_IN simple_JJ inadvertence_NN they_PRP would_MD carry_VB off_RP the_DT effigies_NNS at_IN
the_DT door_NN instead_RB of_IN the_DT living_VBG people_NNS in_IN the_DT house_NN According_VBG to_TO
tradition_NN these_DT woollen_JJ figures_NNS were_VBD substitutes_NNS for_IN a_DT former_JJ
custom_NN of_IN sacrificing_VBG human_JJ beings_NNS Upon_IN data_NNS so_IN fragmentary_JJ and_CC
uncertain_JJ it_PRP is_VBZ impossible_JJ to_TO build_VB with_IN confidence_NN but_CC it_PRP seems_VBZ
worth_JJ suggesting_VBG that_IN the_DT loaves_NNS in_IN human_JJ form_NN which_WDT appear_VBP to_TO have_VB
been_VBN baked_VBN at_IN Aricia_NNP were_VBD sacramental_JJ bread_NN and_CC that_IN in_IN the_DT old_JJ
days_NNS when_WRB the_DT divine_JJ King_NNP of_IN the_DT Wood_NNP was_VBD annually_RB slain_VB loaves_NNS
were_VBD made_VBN in_IN his_PRP$ image_NN like_IN the_DT paste_NN figures_NNS of_IN the_DT gods_NNS in_IN
Mexico_NNP and_CC were_VBD eaten_VBN sacramentally_RB by_IN his_PRP$ worshippers_NNS The_DT Mexican_JJ

the_DT time_NN varied_VBN with_IN a_DT festival_NN of_IN dreams_NNS like_IN that_WDT which_WDT the_DT

general_JJ license_NN the_DT people_NNS were_VBD supposed_VBN to_TO be_VB out_IN of_IN their_PRP$ senses_NNS
and_CC therefore_RB not_RB to_TO be_VB responsible_JJ for_IN what_WP they_PRP did_VBD Accordingly_RB
many_JJ seized_VBD the_DT opportunity_NN of_IN paying_VBG off_RP old_JJ scores_NNS by_IN belabouring_VBG

amid_IN this_DT hubbub_NN all_DT scream_NN at_IN the_DT pitch_NN of_IN their_PRP$ voices_NNS


Witch_NNP flee_NN flee_NN from_IN here_RB or_CC it_PRP will_MD go_VB ill_RB with_IN thee_NN


Then_RB they_PRP run_VBP seven_CD times_NNS round_RB the_DT houses_NNS the_DT yards_NNS and_CC the_DT
village_NN So_IN the_DT witches_NNS are_VBP smoked_VBN out_IN of_IN their_PRP$ lurking-places_NNS and_CC

is_VBZ still_RB or_CC was_VBD down_RB to_TO recent_JJ years_NNS observed_VBD in_IN many_JJ parts_NNS of_IN

while_IN in_IN unison_NN with_IN all_DT their_PRP$ strength_NN This_DT drives_NNS away_RB the_DT
witches_NNS for_IN so_RB far_RB as_IN the_DT sound_NN of_IN the_DT whips_NNS is_VBZ heard_VBN these_DT

Another_DT witching_NN time_NN is_VBZ the_DT period_NN of_IN twelve_CD days_NNS between_IN Christmas_NNP
and_CC Epiphany_NNP Hence_RB in_IN some_DT parts_NNS of_IN Silesia_NNP the_DT people_NNS burn_VBP

away_RB from_IN house_NN and_CC homestead_RB and_CC on_IN Christmas_NNP Eve_NNP and_CC New_NNP Year_NN s_VBZ

LVII_NNP Public_NNP Scapegoats_NNPS



The_DT Expulsion_NN of_IN Embodied_NNP Evils_.

THUS_RB far_RB we_PRP have_VBP dealt_VBN with_IN that_DT class_NN of_IN the_DT general_JJ expulsion_NN of_IN
evils_NNS which_WDT I_PRP have_VBP called_VBN direct_JJ or_CC immediate_JJ In_IN this_DT class_NN the_DT
evils_NNS are_VBP invisible_JJ at_IN least_JJS to_TO common_JJ eyes_NNS and_CC the_DT mode_NN of_IN
deliverance_NN consists_VBZ for_IN the_DT most_JJS part_NN in_IN beating_VBG the_DT empty_JJ air_NN and_CC

which_WDT acts_VBZ as_IN a_DT vehicle_NN to_TO draw_VB them_PRP off_RP from_IN the_DT people_NNS village_NN
or_CC town_NN

The_DT Pomos_NNP of_IN California_NNP celebrate_VBP an_DT expulsion_NN of_IN devils_NNS every_DT seven_CD
years_NNS at_IN which_WDT the_DT devils_NNS are_VBP represented_VBN by_IN disguised_JJ men_NNS Twenty_CD
or_CC thirty_CD men_NNS array_NN themselves_PRP in_IN harlequin_NN rig_NN and_CC barbaric_JJ paint_NN
and_CC put_VBD vessels_NNS of_IN pitch_NN on_IN their_PRP$ heads_NNS then_RB they_PRP secretly_RB go_VBP out_IN
into_IN the_DT surrounding_VBG mountains_NNS These_DT are_VBP to_TO personify_VB the_DT devils_NNS A_DT

on_IN the_DT banks_NNS of_IN the_DT river_NN the_DT Mandan_NNP Indians_NNPS celebrated_VBD their_PRP$ great_JJ

the_DT devil_NN A_DT man_NN painted_VBD black_JJ to_TO represent_VB the_DT devil_NN entered_VBD the_DT
village_NN from_IN the_DT prairie_NN chased_JJ and_CC frightened_VBD the_DT women_NNS and_CC acted_VBN
the_DT part_NN of_IN a_DT buffalo_NN bull_NN in_IN the_DT buffalo_NN dance_VBP the_DT object_NN of_IN which_WDT
was_VBD to_TO ensure_VB a_DT plentiful_JJ supply_NN of_IN buffaloes_NNS during_IN the_DT ensuing_VBG
year_NN Finally_RB he_PRP was_VBD chased_VBN from_IN the_DT village_NN the_DT women_NNS pursuing_VBG him_PRP
with_IN hisses_NNS and_CC gibes_NNS beating_VBG him_PRP with_IN sticks_NNS and_CC pelting_VBG him_PRP with_IN
dirt_NN

run_VB them_PRP through_IN Great_NNP is_VBZ the_DT excitement_NN loud_RB are_VBP the_DT shrieks_NNS and_CC

gloom_NN On_IN the_DT last_JJ night_NN of_IN the_DT year_NN the_DT palace_NN of_IN the_DT Kings_NNP of_IN

consecrated_VBN thread_NN of_IN cotton_NN is_VBZ stretched_VBN round_RB the_DT palace_NN to_TO keep_VB

convenient_JJ to_TO distinguish_VB between_IN occasional_JJ and_CC periodical_JJ

The_DT Occasional_JJ Expulsion_NN of_IN Evils_NNP in_IN a_DT Material_NNP Vehicle_NNP

THE_DT VEHICLE_NNP which_WDT conveys_VBZ away_RB the_DT demons_NNS may_MD be_VB of_IN various_JJ kinds_NNS A_DT
common_JJ one_CD is_VBZ a_DT little_JJ ship_NN or_CC boat_NN Thus_RB in_IN the_DT southern_JJ district_NN
of_IN the_DT island_NN of_IN Ceram_NNP when_WRB a_DT whole_JJ village_NN suffers_NNS from_IN sickness_NN
a_DT small_JJ ship_NN is_VBZ made_VBN and_CC filled_VBN with_IN rice_NN tobacco_NN eggs_NNS and_CC so_RB
forth_RB which_WDT have_VBP been_VBN contributed_VBN by_IN all_PDT the_DT people_NNS A_DT little_JJ sail_NN
is_VBZ hoisted_VBN on_IN the_DT ship_NN When_WRB all_DT is_VBZ ready_JJ a_DT man_NN calls_VBZ out_RP in_IN a_DT very_RB
loud_JJ voice_NN O_NNP all_DT ye_PRP sicknesses_NNS ye_PRP smallpoxes_VBZ agues_NNS measles_NNS
etc_FW who_WP have_VBP visited_VBN us_PRP so_RB long_RB and_CC wasted_VBD us_PRP so_RB sorely_RB but_CC who_WP
now_RB cease_VB to_TO plague_VB us_PRP we_PRP have_VBP made_VBN ready_JJ this_DT ship_NN for_IN you_PRP and_CC we_PRP

of_IN tobacco_NN Depart_NNP and_CC sail_VB away_RB from_IN us_PRP directly_RB never_RB come_VBN near_IN

from_IN here_RB turn_NN back_RB what_WP do_VBP you_PRP here_RB in_IN this_DT poor_JJ land_NN Three_CD

Often_RB the_DT vehicle_NN which_WDT carries_VBZ away_RB the_DT collected_VBN demons_NNS or_CC ills_NNS of_IN
a_DT whole_JJ community_NN is_VBZ an_DT animal_NN or_CC scapegoat_NN In_IN the_DT Central_NN

neither_RB in_IN heaven_NN nor_CC in_IN earth_NN but_CC as_RB far_RB as_IN possible_JJ suspended_VBN
between_IN the_DT two_CD




LXI_NNP The_DT Myth_NNP of_IN Balder_NN

A_DT DEITY_NN whose_WP$ life_NN might_MD in_RP a_DT sense_NN be_VB said_VBN to_TO be_VB neither_RB in_IN heaven_NN
nor_CC on_IN earth_NN but_CC between_IN the_DT two_CD was_VBD the_DT Norse_NNP Balder_NNP the_DT good_JJ and_CC
beautiful_JJ god_NN the_DT son_NN of_IN the_DT great_JJ god_NN Odin_NNP and_CC himself_PRP the_DT
wisest_JJS mildest_JJS best_JJS beloved_NN of_IN all_PDT the_DT immortals_NNS The_DT story_NN of_IN his_PRP$
death_NN as_IN it_PRP is_VBZ told_VBN in_IN the_DT younger_JJR or_CC prose_NN Edda_NNP runs_VBZ thus_RB Once_RB
on_IN a_DT time_NN Balder_NN dreamed_VBD heavy_JJ dreams_NNS which_WDT seemed_VBD to_TO forebode_VB his_PRP$

secure_VB against_IN every_DT danger_NN So_IN the_DT goddess_JJ Frigg_NNP took_VBD an_DT oath_NN from_IN

The_DT Easter_NNP Fires_NNPS

ANOTHER_NNP occasion_NN on_IN which_WDT these_DT fire-festivals_NNS are_VBP held_VBN is_VBZ Easter_NNP
Eve_NNP the_DT Saturday_NNP before_IN Easter_NNP Sunday_NNP On_IN that_DT day_NN it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN
customary_JJ in_IN Catholic_NNP countries_NNS to_TO extinguish_VB all_DT the_DT lights_NNS in_IN the_DT
churches_NNS and_CC then_RB to_TO make_VB a_DT new_JJ fire_NN sometimes_RB with_IN flint_NN and_CC

Paschal_NNP or_CC Easter_NNP candle_NN which_WDT is_VBZ then_RB used_VBN to_TO rekindle_VB all_PDT the_DT
extinguished_JJ lights_NNS in_IN the_DT church_NN In_IN many_JJ parts_NNS of_IN Germany_NNP a_DT
bonfire_NN is_VBZ also_RB kindled_VBN by_IN means_NNS of_IN the_DT new_JJ fire_NN on_IN some_DT open_JJ
space_NN near_IN the_DT church_NN It_PRP is_VBZ consecrated_VBN and_CC the_DT people_NNS bring_VBP
sticks_NNS of_IN oak_NN walnut_NN and_CC beech_NN which_WDT they_PRP char_VBP in_IN the_DT fire_NN and_CC
then_RB take_VB home_NN with_IN them_PRP Some_DT of_IN these_DT charred_JJ sticks_NNS are_VBP thereupon_RB
burned_VBN at_IN home_NN in_IN a_DT newly-kindled_JJ fire_NN with_IN a_DT prayer_NN that_IN God_NNP will_MD
preserve_VB the_DT homestead_NN from_IN fire_NN lightning_NN and_CC hail_NN Thus_RB every_DT
house_NN receives_VBZ new_JJ fire_NN Some_DT of_IN the_DT sticks_NNS are_VBP kept_VBN throughout_IN
the_DT year_NN and_CC laid_VBD on_IN the_DT hearth-fire_NN during_IN heavy_JJ thunder-storms_NNS to_TO
prevent_VB the_DT house_NN from_IN being_VBG struck_VBN by_IN lightning_NN or_CC they_PRP are_VBP
inserted_VBN in_IN the_DT roof_NN with_IN the_DT like_JJ intention_NN Others_NNS are_VBP placed_VBN in_IN
the_DT fields_NNS gardens_NNS and_CC meadows_NNS with_IN a_DT prayer_NN that_IN God_NNP will_MD keep_VB
them_PRP from_IN blight_NN and_CC hail_NN Such_JJ fields_NNS and_CC gardens_NNS are_VBP thought_VBN to_TO
thrive_VBP more_RBR than_IN others_NNS the_DT corn_NN and_CC the_DT plants_NNS that_WDT grow_VBP in_IN them_PRP
are_VBP not_RB beaten_VBN down_RP by_IN hail_NN nor_CC devoured_VBN by_IN mice_NNS vermin_RB and_CC
beetles_VBZ no_DT witch_NN harms_VBZ them_PRP and_CC the_DT ears_NNS of_IN corn_NN stand_NN close_RB and_CC
full_JJ The_DT charred_JJ sticks_NNS are_VBP also_RB applied_VBN to_TO the_DT plough_JJ The_DT ashes_NNS
of_IN the_DT Easter_NNP bonfire_NN together_RB with_IN the_DT ashes_NNS of_IN the_DT consecrated_VBN
palm-branches_NNS are_VBP mixed_VBN with_IN the_DT seed_NN at_IN sowing_NN A_DT wooden_JJ figure_NN
called_VBN Judas_NNP is_VBZ sometimes_RB burned_VBN in_IN the_DT consecrated_JJ bonfire_NN and_CC
even_RB where_WRB this_DT custom_NN has_VBZ been_VBN abolished_VBN the_DT bonfire_NN itself_PRP in_IN some_DT
places_NNS goes_VBZ by_IN the_DT name_NN of_IN the_DT burning_NN of_IN Judas_NNP

The_DT essentially_RB pagan_JJ character_NN of_IN the_DT Easter_NNP fire_NN festival_NN appears_NNS
plainly_RB both_DT from_IN the_DT mode_NN in_IN which_WDT it_PRP is_VBZ celebrated_VBN by_IN the_DT peasants_NNS
and_CC from_IN the_DT superstitious_JJ beliefs_NNS which_WDT they_PRP associate_VBP with_IN it_PRP All_RB
over_IN Northern_NNP and_CC Central_NNP Germany_NNP from_IN Altmark_NNP and_CC Anhalt_NNP on_IN the_DT
east_RB through_IN Brunswick_NNP Hanover_NNP Oldenburg_NNP the_DT Harz_NNP district_NN and_CC
Hesse_NNP to_TO Westphalia_NNP the_DT Easter_NNP bonfires_NNS still_RB blaze_VBP simultaneously_RB
on_IN the_DT hill-tops_NNS As_IN many_JJ as_IN forty_CD may_MD sometimes_RB be_VB counted_VBN within_IN
sight_NN at_IN once_RB Long_RB before_IN Easter_NNP the_DT young_JJ people_NNS have_VBP been_VBN busy_JJ
collecting_VBG firewood_RB every_DT farmer_NN contributes_NNS and_CC tar-barrels_NNS
petroleum_NN cases_NNS and_CC so_RB forth_RB go_VB to_TO swell_VB the_DT pile_NN Neighbouring_.

The_DT Beltane_NN Fires_NNS

IN_IN THE_DT CENTRAL_NNP Highlands_NNP of_IN Scotland_NNP bonfires_NNS known_VBN as_IN the_DT Beltane_NN
fires_NNS were_VBD formerly_RB kindled_VBN with_IN great_JJ ceremony_NN on_IN the_DT first_JJ of_IN
May_NNP and_CC the_DT traces_NNS of_IN human_JJ sacrifices_NNS at_IN them_PRP were_VBD particularly_RB
clear_JJ and_CC unequivocal_JJ The_DT custom_NN of_IN lighting_VBG the_DT bonfires_NNS lasted_VBD in_IN
various_JJ places_NNS far_RB into_IN the_DT eighteenth_JJ century_NN and_CC the_DT descriptions_NNS
of_IN the_DT ceremony_NN by_IN writers_NNS of_IN that_DT period_NN present_VB such_JJ a_DT curious_JJ and_CC
interesting_JJ picture_NN of_IN ancient_JJ heathendom_NN surviving_VBG in_IN our_PRP$ own_JJ
country_NN that_IN I_PRP will_MD reproduce_VB them_PRP in_IN the_DT words_NNS of_IN their_PRP$ authors_NNS
The_DT fullest_JJS of_IN the_DT descriptions_NNS is_VBZ the_DT one_CD bequeathed_VBN to_TO us_PRP by_IN John_NNP
Ramsay_NNP laird_NN of_IN Ochtertyre_NNP near_IN Crieff_NNP the_DT patron_NN of_IN Burns_NNP and_CC
the_DT friend_NN of_IN Sir_NNP Walter_NNP Scott_NNP He_PRP says_VBZ But_CC the_DT most_RBS considerable_JJ
of_IN the_DT Druidical_NNP festivals_NNS is_VBZ that_IN of_IN Beltane_NN or_CC May-day_NNP which_WDT was_VBD
lately_RB observed_VBD in_IN some_DT parts_NNS of_IN the_DT Highlands_NNP with_IN extraordinary_JJ
ceremonies_NNS Like_IN the_DT other_JJ public_JJ worship_NN of_IN the_DT Druids_NNS the_DT
Beltane_NN feast_NN seems_VBZ to_TO have_VB been_VBN performed_VBN on_IN hills_NNS or_CC eminences_NNS

suppose_VB that_IN he_PRP would_MD dwell_VB in_IN any_DT house_NN made_VBN with_IN hands_NNS Their_PRP$

of_IN nature_NN and_CC were_VBD nearest_JJS the_DT seat_NN of_IN warmth_NN and_CC order_NN And_CC
according_VBG to_TO tradition_NN such_JJ was_VBD the_DT manner_NN of_IN celebrating_VBG this_DT

that_IN which_WDT was_VBD used_VBN in_IN the_DT islands_NNS of_IN Skye_NNP Mull_NNP and_CC Tiree_NNP A_NNP

Thomas_NNP Pennant_NNP who_WP travelled_VBD in_IN Perthshire_NNP in_IN the_DT year_NN tells_VBZ

LXIV_NNP The_DT Burning_NNP of_IN Human_NNP Beings_NNP in_IN the_DT Fires_NNPS



The_DT Burning_NN of_IN Effigies_NNS in_IN the_DT Fires_NNPS
